Question 40.Question: Please describe any differences in how it impacted your learning (comparing GenAI and your teacher)?
Question 40.Response: It depends on the type of feedback I'm seeking. AI is useful for reinforcement of content learnt in class. Concepts and definitions that we run through very quickly in class I can revert to AI to help revise. It is also quite good with providing examples etc, but only aspect I am wary of is Chatgpt's unreliability with numbers/figures in calculations. It is fine for more qualitative questions. Other AI engines like copilot I think is possibly more accurate in calcs.

Question 41.Question: Were there any differences in how the feedback made you feel (comparing GenAI and your teacher)?
Question 41.Response: Teacher is always busy and so having AI as a tool/tutor at home available any time I want is good. So the increasing dependence on AI as a tutor. I still think that the teacher has a role, but it may be diminished with AI now.

Question 42.Question: Describe any other differences between the feedback you received from GenAI and your teacher.
Question 42.Response: The teacher is more aware of context and real world situations, so will assess questions in light of the nuances. AI is limited in that respect.
